intro: Palicourea longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed palicourea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. Its small, tubular flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and prominent stamens. Palicourea longipes is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
